Francisco Cerezo Canto <francisco.cerezo.canto_hp.com>, 02/06/2017:
Respecto a qué mantenimientos ha de mostrar una printer cuando ha sido actualizada a una versión posterior de PrintCare, han decidido que se mostrarán todos hasta una determinada fecha.
Esa fecha estará basada en la última fecha que la printer actualizó los datos a PrintCare DB. Si pasado X tiempo no se actualiza un mantenimiento, se dejará de reportar y dejará de aparecer en Sonar/API.
El valor de X será un cálculo del máximo de días actualización de una printer a PrintCare DB + stdev de media de esos días. De esta manera, aseguraremos que no perdemos información ni dejamos de mostrarla demasiado pronto.
Estamos en fase de cálculo de esa X. en cuanto tengamos esa info, el equipo de Sonar abrirá un nuevo ticket en ALM y lo pasarán al equipo para su desarrollo.

Field.Name: description
Field.Value:
DESCRIPTION: Printer maintenance status is not the same in Sonar and PrintCare

STEPS TO REPRODUCE:
Precondition: Printer is sending info to Sonar, Printer have one or more mainteinance in Warning Status. (In this scenario a 500L Warning was generated, getting a 125L Halt in the process as expected)
1) Log in to Sonar
2) Go to Control Tower Dashboard and search for the printer form the precondition.
3) Observe mainteinance % values.
4) Search for the printer from the precondition in Seals API.
5) Observe mainteinance % values.
6) In the printer, open Print Care.
7) Click on Mainteinance, Mainteinance Tasks.
8) Observe the Mainteinance status.

ACTUAL RESULTS:
Printer mainteinance status is not the same in Sonar and PrintCare, is displaying a Warning on PrintCare but in Sonar is just 60%.

EXPECTED RESULTS:
Printer mainteinance status is not the same in Sonar and PrintCare. % should be the same or displaying the same Status.
According to Sonar team and Alvaro:
Sonar Mainteinance Status Range
<= 100 %                             -->  Status On time
> 100 %   <= 115%            --> Status Warning
> 115%                                --> Status Halt
PrintCare Mainteinance Status Range
<= 80%                                -->  Status On time
> 80%   <=100%                 --> Status Warning
> 100% <=120%                --> Status Critical
> 120%                                --> Status Halt

ENVIRONMENT: (Hardware, OS, OS Version, Browser, etc)
Thor 2 (Lx 3600)/ Windows 7 64 bit/ FW ALTAMIRA_11_01_01.3/ IPS 2017.5.6.2/ PrintCare 2.2.5.1/ SN 1HA07A/ PN SG51S1R001

DESCRIPTION:  Icons do not match with status of a device which comes from unknown status to another status.


STEPS TO REPRODUCE:
Step 1: Sign in to PrintOS PSP account (i.e: testdcswqa / Testeo*01)
Step 2: Provoke that a device gets the unknown status (i.e disconnecting Command Center from the network).
Step 3: Once the device gets the unknown status, wait approximately 20 minutes.
Step 4: Change its status from another one (i.e: error).

Field.Name: description
Field.Value:
DESCRIPTION:
When a PSP shares printer infor with the reseller, it may not have assigned a Site to the printer, if Service Center added the printer with version1 and autopopulated the site without adding it to the Reseller PrintOS Sites, we need to change the Site info for a Printer. There is no UI to handle this interaction, when updating info, the only option is to create a new one, but no menu allows us to select one of the existing Sites already defined in Admin->Sites view.

STEPS TO REPRODUCE:
Login to PrintOS (Production) with reselleraccount / admin123*
Go to Installed Base and select HP Inc. LFP - PSP customer
Locate printer by ctrl+f (MY3C91900P)
Notice generic "Spain" Site
Click on exclamation mark to the right and click on "Edit Info" link


ACTUAL RESULTS:
There is no way to select the already created sites

EXPECTED RESULTS:
Apart from the option to create a new site, it should be possible to select one of the already available ones.

ENVIRONMENT: (Hardware, OS, OS Version, Browser, etc)

Field.Name: name
Field.Value: [ServiceCenter] Unable to select an existing site when updating Site info for a printer already registered and shared with the reseller

Field.Name: user-63
Field.Value: Fixed in production

Field.Value:

Carlos Barrera Hernandez <grupocapgemini-services.carlos.barrera_hp.com>, 20/11/2017: This site cannot be assigned to printer, it is only used to fill the case registration. In any case a Site registered in the Reseller can NEVER be created on the PSP, because only the PSP can create or accept a new site in his/her account.

DESCRIPTION: Company column in customer invitation is not being filling out after register a printer or customer. It's happening with news customers who full the form with company information, existing customers who have information of the company and we can see how moths ago the process was properly completed with all the information.

STEPS TO REPRODUCE:
Case 1:
1) Access to Service Center with reselleraccount.
2) Go to installed base.
3) click on add customer.
4) Complete all the form and send the invitation.
5) Close the reseller account.
6) Access to the email of the created "customer" for this test.
7) Click on the invitation email from Service Center and click on accept invitation.
8) Fill the form with all the information and accept.
9) Access again with the resellleraccount.
10) Access to Service Center with reselleraccount.
11) Go to admin - Customer invitations.
12) Search the email of the customer.
13) Observe results.
Case 2:
1) Access to Service Center with reselleraccount.
2) Go to installed base.
3) Select "HP Inc. LFP - PSP"
3) click on add printer
4) Complete all the form and send the invitation.
5) Close the reseller account.
6) Access to the email of "HP Inc. LFP - PSP".
7) Click on the invitation email from Service Center and click on connect.
8) Fill the form with all the information and accept.
9) Access again with the resellleraccount.
11) Go to admin - Customer invitations.
12) Search the email of the customer.
13) Observe results.


ACTUAL RESULTS:
The company column does not have any information of the customer

EXPECTED RESULTS:T
The company column should have information of the PSP Organization filled.

ENVIRONMENT: (Hardware, OS, OS Version, Browser, etc)

DESCRIPTION: Printers without an asigned site are not properly displayed at Home. Consider a PSP with 4 printers which are not asigned to any site. In Home, they will be displayed one by one with the number of its PSP, so that it seems that there are 4 PSP with the same name with printers without site instead of a PSP with 4 printers without site. A video of the process is attached in order to understand better the issue.


STEPS TO REPRODUCE:
pre-condition: PROD stack. Have a PSP account with some printers which are not asigned to a site
Step 1: Sign in to PrintOS with a reseller credentials (i.e: teamswqa ( Testeo*01).
Step 2: Go to Home and take a look at the sites which are reported in the "by default" site.

Step 3: Sites of those PSPs which have neither sites nor printers asigned to sites will appear with the name of the PSP n times (where "n" is the number of printers which are not asigned to a site for that PSP)


ACTUAL RESULTS: Printers without an asigned site are not properly displayed at Home.


EXPECTED RESULTS: Printers without an asigned site should be properly displayed at Home.


ENVIRONMENT: Z600 Workstation, Windows 10x64, Mozilla Firefox.
Note: Video attached

Field.Name: description
Field.Value:
DESCRIPTION: [ServiceCenter] Service Center shows SEs in future when date set in IPS or in Printer System is in the future


STEPS TO REPRODUCE:
Precondition: Printer is being shared with the reseller.
Note that for this test we are advancing the time of the printer but usually the customer can find the time advanced without any taken action, for this reason we must to advance the hour manually.
1. Printer Time is set in the future:
1.1. Access to the IPS of the Printer (PC Target SN:HP00013600 PN:1HA07A) and set time in the future.
1.2. Access to the TCL of the printer and advance time unless one hour with the command "Date 121513502017" explanation "mothdayhourminutesyear".
2. Provoke a SE (example "01.01.00:01").
3. Go to Service Center Production and observe result on the left dashboard from PSP customer (HP Inc. LFP - PSP).
4. Go to installed base and select the printer.
5. Observe Results.

ACTUAL RESULTS:
It shows the notification in future

EXPECTED RESULTS:
Shows some alert warning that Printer time is advanced in the future.

ENVIRONMENT: (Hardware, OS, OS Version, Browser, etc)
Thor 2 (Lx 3600)/ Windows 7 64 bit/ FW ALTAMIRA_11_01_01.3/ IPS 2017.5.6.2/ PrintCare 2.2.5.1/ PN 1HA07A/ SN HP00013600

Field.Name: description

DESCRIPTION: PrintOS shows SEs in future when date set in IPS or in Printer System is in the future

STEPS TO REPRODUCE:
Precondition: Printer is being shared with the reseller.
Note that for this test we are advancing the time of the printer but usually the customer can find the time advanced without any taken action, for this reason we must to advance the hour manually.
1. Printer Time is set in the future:
1.1. Access to the IPS of the Printer (PC Target SN:HP00013600 PN:1HA07A) and set time in the future.
1.2. Access to the TCL of the printer and advance time unless one hour with the command "Date 121513502017" explanation "mothdayhourminutesyear".
2. Provoke a SE (example "01.01.00:01").
3. Go to Service Center
4. Go to My applications and click on account.
5.  Click on devices and look for printer of point 1.1
4. Select the printer.
5. Observe Results.

ACTUAL RESULTS:
It shows the notifications in future

EXPECTED RESULTS:
Shows some alert warning that Printer time is advanced in the future.

ENVIRONMENT: (Hardware, OS, OS Version, Browser, etc)

Thor 2 (Lx 3600)/ Windows 7 64 bit/ FW ALTAMIRA_11_01_01.3/ IPS 2017.5.6.2/ PrintCare 2.2.5.1/ PN 1HA07A/ SN SG51S1R001

Field.Name: description
Field.Value:
DESCRIPTION:

Customer escalation: Wenpoo (APJ)
After upgrading the software and firmware to the last version the device cannot be added to the Command center. When trying to login to PrintOS with the Client user the screen shows connecting but it never ends.

Several troubleshooting tried:

1. Client account can be accesed from PrintOS web site.
2. Different client accounts tried but no success (No logged as reseller account)
3. Server is running and connected (tried with 3dpconfig.heleni.me)

Debugging information retrieved from folder "C:\Windows\ServiceProfiles\LocalService\AppData\Roaming\HP"
Troubleshooting was made with the printer, the Processing Station does not have LAN cable avaliable.
Attached debugging information

Quim Muntal Diaz <quim.muntal.diaz_hp.com>, 17-Jan-18: [edited]  It seems to be a proxy or firewall missconfiguration. I would need to connect remotly with the server PC to know the specific firewall or proxy error.

Sabela Sanchez <grupocapgemini-services.sabela.sanchez_hp.com>, 22/01/2018: We recommended customer to review firewall configuration and make sure the following endpoints are allowed:
a. www.printos.com , port 443
b. 3dpconfig.heleni.me, port 443
c. 3dp-gw.gbd.hp10.us, port 443
d. amazonaws.com:443
And also the recommendations about network adapter previously provided. In case issue is not solved we will contact connectivity engineer to connect remotely to customer server PC.

Sabela Sanchez <grupocapgemini-services.sabela.sanchez_hp.com>, 05/02/2018: Issue solved in Nuaovamacut after conectivity team call.
FormID case solved after adding the firewall exceptions.

DESCRIPTION:
In the mobile app, the views for printer details in the tabs for alert history, printhead history and status history, the user can't select a date range to lookup the data. The spec do not provide the time fram the mobile app is requesting by default, so we don't know the dates we are supposed to be getting the info about.

STEPS TO REPRODUCE:
1. Download Service Center Mobile from repository from developers ( https://www.dropbox.com/sh/d8xzza9hzd1ledb/AADEq6rRUaInELFOlE6MU5wAa?dl=0 )
2. Login to app with credentials: reselleraccount / admin123*
3. Select one printer and go to tabs for alert history, printhead history or astatus history


ACTUAL RESULTS:

User can't broaden or narrow the date range where the information is presented.


EXPECTED RESULTS:

User can select the dates between which to request the printer's info.

ENVIRONMENT: (Hardware, OS, OS Version, Browser, etc)

Field.Name: description
Field.Value:
DESCRIPTION:
When a printer has not updated status in a long time, PrintOS shows it as unknown status, but Service Center shows it as No Issue and continues to act as if it was updating data, showing a last update of no more than 5 minutes.

STEPS TO REPRODUCE:
Log in to PrintOS as an HP Views capable account
Go to Service Center and wait until HP Views loads
Click on "Access Service Center for APJ" link
Go to Account->Devicesin the app switcher and locate printer GIST(M0P44B / SG77R34002) , notice Unkwonw status and last update a month ago
Go to Service Center again
On sidebar, filter by SN and select the same printer

ACTUAL RESULTS: 

Printer in SC shows as no-issue, and last update  not consistent with PrintOS

EXPECTED RESULTS:
If the status has not been updated from the printer in a long time, Unknown status should be applied to the printer, and the "time in this status" info should be modulated to indicate how long has the status been without updates.

ENVIRONMENT: (Hardware, OS, OS Version, Browser, etc)

Field.Value: [ServiceCenter] In Installed base->Printer Details, last update is refreshing as if status received when no data is sent to PrintOS

Andrew Young <andrew.m.young_hp.com>, 6/8/2018: It looks like we are redirecting to Service Center, where the inbound link doesn't resolve since the user isn't in the proper context. Thus service center reedirects the user to Printos Dashboard instead of displaying a cannot find printer error. The reason the printer is not found is because the user is logged into a different context. For more info, talk to Bettineski or JVM.

If user has more than one account, then the behaviour is that the User will be redirected to the Dashboard, since the inbound link doesn't resolve since the user isn't in the proper context.

Carlos Barrera Hernandez <grupocapgemini-services.carlos.barrera_hp.com>, 29/08/2018: Received response from developers:
"Hi @carlosbarrera,
I don't think anything needs to be fixed here.
When the map is zoomed out, two or more marker-clusters will be merged to form a new marker-cluster in a new position between them. This is the normal behavior of a Marker Cluster.
In the above case, marker-cluster at house icon is merged with other marker-clusters/markers and forms a new marker-cluster. Their combined PSP information will be displayed at the newly formed marked-cluster .
Thanks:)"
Seems like even though it looks kind of weird, it is the expected behaviour.

________________________________________
Alberto Lendinez Gutierrez <grupocapgemini-services.alberto.lendinez_hp.com>, 29/08/2018: Accepting explanation. Closing the issue.

DESCRIPTION:
When clicking on the link of a case management notification corresponding to a case already created on SC, the link is not correctly redirecting to the case details page in Service Delivery Cases & elevations. At the same time, if clicking on the table of Service Delivery-> Cases & elevations table, it works as expected.

STEPS TO REPRODUCE:

Generate a notification on Stg for account HP Inc. LFP - Reseller using the following API call with the relevant AAA token:
POST /api/notification-service/v1/event/notify HTTP/1.1
Host: daily.gsbprint.net
Content-Type: application/json
Cookie: Indigo-SmS-Auth-Token=1kja4j1uplqo90fldp386n7jah
Cache-Control: no-cache
{
  "eventName": "EVENT_SERVICE_CENTER_CASE_UPDATE",
  "linkLabel": "HP Latex 570 printer (S/N: LV456014)",
  "subValue": "Large Scale Prints",
  "orgId": "4e04d86b-5a8c-404b-ad52-ea1c8d2734f7",
  "targetedUserId": null,
  "entityId": "5001169011",
  "timestamp": "2018-01-10T09:23:46.901Z"
                
}
Login to PrintOS Stg stack with reselleraccount / admin123*
Go to Service Center (to bypass known issue related to clicking on notification link before loading the SC home page)
Go to Service Delivery->Cases & Elevations and click on case with caseID 5001169011
Observe results
Click on notification created in step 1


ACTUAL RESULTS:
When clicking on notification link, the page does not present the case info and shows an Id:undefined breadcrumb navigation item.

EXPECTED RESULTS:

When clicking the notification link, we obtain the same results as if loading manually the same case in the Case & elevations table.

DESCRIPTION: [ServiceCenter] Warranty "end date" is not being updated through SEALS API
Service Center Warranty "end date" is not being updated, we have tryed with the postman API but the result is the same date not the new date thant we can see on  "https://entitlement-ui-hpi-int.corp.hp.com" which the date is "27-Jan-2018".

Precondition: We have some printer being shared and have a current warranty

STEPS TO REPRODUCE:
1) Acces to Service Center stack Production with the user reselleraccount pwd admin123*
2) Go to installed base.
3) Select the printer PC target - SN HP00013600 PN: 1HA07A.
4) Observe the information on Warranty end date.
5) Go to Postman program.
6) Launch the request " GET https://seals-itg.hpcloud.hp.com/SEALSRestAPI/GetObligations?serialNumber=HP00013600&productID=1HA07A&Mode=all
7) Observe the section "end date" of warranty.
8) Go to "https://entitlement-ui-hpi-int.corp.hp.com/webclient/WebClient/Main.do"
9) Access with your user information.
10) Click on Entitlement Search,
11) Full the serial number and Product number with the previous printer information and ISO code as ES.
12) As "Entitlement Types and Search Options" select "warranty".
13) click on the "Search entitlements button".
14)Observe and compare with the previous information.

ACTUAL RESULTS:
Shows the previous information of the warranty before we changed the "warranty end date"

EXPECTED RESULTS:
Shows the expected "warranty end date"

ENVIRONMENT: (Hardware, OS, OS Version, Browser, etc)
Thor 2 (Lx 3600)/ Windows 7 64 bit/ FW ALTAMIRA_11_01_01.3/ IPS 2017.5.6.2/ PrintCare 2.2.5.1/ PN 1HA07A/ SN SG51S1R001

Me he bajado el openxml que tiene la printer a través del EWS y veo que tiene todos los campos de job llenos (ex: job name). Sin embargo estamos reciibiendo los jobs sin nombre ni datos. Puedes comparar los dos opens attached en este issue.

Thanks,
Marc

________________________________________
Nicolas Guemes Delgado <altran-services.nicolas.guemes.delgado_hp.com>, 2018-02-22:
The attached OpenXMLs are different in nature.
The PrintOS payload contains the OpenQueue XML data, while the attached XMl is an Open Accounting XML data.
As has been explained in person, the first iteration of OpenQueue uses the same structure as OpenAccounting, but cannot provide information for most fields. We're working on improving this.
As for the job names, on OpenAccounting it can be observed that many jobs have their sequence number as the job name, this is because there's a security setting enabled in the EWS that prevents displaying the job name for privacy reasons. When said setting is enabled, jobs in OpenAccounting will have their sequence number as a name (with the excepcion of service or internal plots, which remain unchanged), and jobs in OpenQueue will have no name (since they don't have a sequence number available).
As such, the attached OpenXMLs are correct.

Also seems that the computer goes to standby from time to time:
{"timestamp":"2018-01-08T19:03:01.824Z","seq":23,"level":"info","processid":8684,"message":"Computer waking up from standy"}

{"timestamp":"2018-01-08T19:03:24.176Z","seq":30,"level":"info","processid":8684,"message":"SSDP server started: 3dpPuBackend"}
Apart from that, don't see any attempt to add a device.

Quim Muntal Diaz <quim.muntal.diaz_hp.com>, 02-Feb-18: There is no comunication CC Server - Client. Is the client in the same computer? If not, probably the firewall is blocking the comunication. Try this:
  1. In the server pc, open CMD with admin rights
  2. Copy and execute this command "netsh advfirewall firewall add rule name="HP Command Center Server" dir=in action=allow protocol=TCP localport=8080"
  3. Restart CC Server and Datacollector
  4. Try again
If this doesn't work but the client is in another computer, try running the client in the same pc

________________________________________
Abel Velasco <grupocapgemini-services.abel.velasco_hp.com>, 2/2/2018: Fixed as per Quim's recommendations

DESCRIPTION:
Information coming from the SEALS endpoints is not checked for valid date ranges depending on current date
/GetObligations
/GetDeviceUtilization
/GetMaintenanceEvents
/GetPrintHeadInfo
/GetErrorEvents
/IsPrinterEntitled
/IsPrinterUnderSupportContract
/GetSolution
/GetTimeToSolution
/GetMaintenanceTasks
/GetIPSUsage
/GetPrinterStatusHistory

EXPECTED RESULTS:
If printer is not currently down, it should not be reported as down.

DESCRIPTION:
After customer accepts to share printer with Reseller, PrintOS should recieve information from machine automatically. But it doesn't happen if user don't go to the printer after that and put the "Service ID" and "Account ID" manually.

STEPS TO REPRODUCE:
First of all we need to ensure that "Data Sharing Agreement" is activated. So we need to go to the printer physically.
1.  Go to Front Panel Tools/ preferences/ Remote assistance. Check if "Enable remote assistance" is enabled. If not, tick it.
2. Go to PrintOS (in Stage) and log in Reseller Account.
3. Go to Service Center/ Installed Base
4. Search your customer and press it to enter in.
5. Press "Add Device"
6. In the new pop-up, fill all the empty boxes
7. When it finish an e-mail is sent to us with a "connect" button, Press it.
8. This button redirect us to PrintOS. Insert your credentials.
9. Another pop up shows our printer model and serial number. Press it to connect.
10. In the last step, another pop-up appears with sharing information. Press Accept.


ACTUAL RESULTS:
After accept Reseller invitation, the printer appears connected but PrintOS doesn't recieve information from printer automatically.

EXPECTED RESULTS:
PrintOS recieves information automatically after accept Reseller invitation.

ENVIRONMENT: (Hardware, OS, OS Version, Browser, etc)
Windows 10 64 bit
Latex 3800 (Mammoth)
FW: ALTAMIRA_13_00_02.1
IPS: 2017.5.13
PrintOS Stage

Field.Name: description
Field.Value:
DESCRIPTION: After adding a substrate in Service Center we insert the supplier code in the IPS (nimbus), and then substrates shared from reseller or public substrates are not showed.
'oms' file for upload to the printer is attached in issue.
Nimbus server is configured in IPS: beta/stg -> mediaserverbeta.heleni.me
Initial conditions:
- The printer (HP10102G) is registered in PrintOS Stage environment.
- User has a valid Nimbus private Supplier code. (For account PrintOS-Reseller-1, the access code is WGXgAWbT)
- The printer is Ready.
- The public medias are loaded with Nimbus application started
PRECONDITIONS:
1. Log in PrintOS with user name and password (Reseller role)
2. Select PrintOS-Reseller-1 account
3. Go to My applications -> Service center
4. Click on 'My substrates'
5. Press on 'Add substrates' button and select the OMES file attached to issue.
6. Check that new substrate is created for printer model 3500 and is shared with the costumer. 

STEPS TO REPRODUCE:
1. Start IPS, and access menu "substrate"
2. Verify that public medias are automatically loaded when Nimbus application is started.
3. Select Private tab
4. Enter supplier code and press OK button. (Use supplier code from preconditions)
5. After some minutes observe results in public tab.
ACTUAL RESULTS:
In public section is showed any substrates and in private section is not showed the private substrates related to introduced code.
Any error message is showed.

EXPECTED RESULTS:
Supplier code for Nimbus private section work as expected, showing the private substrates related to that code.
In public section, the substrates continue being showed normally.

ENVIRONMENT: (Hardware, OS, OS Version, Browser, etc)
Server is configured in IPS: beta/stg -> mediaserverbeta.heleni.me
Account Reseller: PrintOS-Reseller-1
Account Customer: HP Inc. Gaia Testing
Access code: WGXgAWbT
PrintOS Stage environment

Windows 7 64 bit / FW ALTAMIRA_13_00_02.1/IPS 2017.5.13
Simulator - Hp Latex 3500/ PN K4G10A / SN HP10107G

1. Make sure a HP DesignJet Z6dr 44in printer with FW: JGR6_02_18_05.2.WL has been registered on PrintOS (Daily).
2. Power on this printer.
3. Open PrintOS Mobile App (Daily) with PSP account (Organization: Large Scale Prints).
4. Go to the Printer Details of this printer.
5. Check the printer info.

2. Active job info should display when printing.
3. The inks info should update.
4. FW version should be "JGR6_02_18_05.2"
